result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig M. Cooper

records.addlTxt:
10:28 AM Defendant Craig M. Cooper in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file, asks defendant why he is appearing without an attorney. Cooper states he thought his attorney would be appearing - just tried calling him, has retained Jeff Joy. Recess to allow him to call in. Recalled at 10:36 AM. Attorney Joy has not responded, Court will take the defendant's word that he has hired Mr. Joy but if that is not the case - Court will not be happy that Cooper told the Court that. Court will continue bond and sets for another AIA on 11/9/22 at 10:00 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bail/Bond Review scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:05 AM Defendant Craig M. Cooper in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file, asks defendant why he was not here on 7/19/22. Defendant informs Court he was working and forgot about court. Court - bond - $750.00 cash, $500.00 is now forfeited as Court did not receive an objection for doing so, reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Cooper understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, will hire his own - has already talked to Attorney Jeff Joy, needs 60 days to be able to retain Attorney Joy. Court will set for AIA on 9/21/22 at 10:30 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $500.00

10:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Craig M. Cooper not in court. State based on non-appearance, asks for forfeiture of $500 cash bond, summons and complaint was not returned, asks for warrant, body or $750, returnable nationwide. Court so orders.
